1.text: These are the generations of the sons of Noe: Sem, Cham, and Japheth: and unto them sons were born after the flood.

2.text: The sons of Japheth: Gomer, and Magog, and Madai, and Javan, and Thubal, and Mosoch, and Thiras.

3.text: And the sons of Gomer: Ascenez and Riphath and Thogorma.

4.text: And the sons of Javan: Elisa and Tharsis, Cetthim, and Dodanim.

5.text: By these were divided the islands of the Gentiles in their lands, every one according to his tongue and their families in their nations.

6.text: And the sons of Cham: Chus, and Mesram, and Phuth, and Chanaan.

7.text: And the sons of Chus: Saba and Hevila, and Sabatha, and Regma, and Sabatacha. The sons of Regma: Saba and Dadan.

8.text: Now Chus begot Nemrod: he began to be mighty on earth.

9.text: And he was a stout hunter before the Lord. Hence came a proverb: Even as Nemrod the stout hunter before the Lord.

10.text: And the beginning of his kingdom was Babylon, and Arach, and Achad, and Chalanne in the land of Sennaar.

11.text: Out of that land came forth Assur, and built Ninive, and the streets of the city, and Chale.

12.text: Resen also between Ninive and Chale: this is the great city.

13.text: And Mesraim begot Ludim, and Anamim, and Laabim, Nepthuim,

14.text: And Phetrusim, and Chasluim; of whom came forth the Philistines, and the Capthorim.

15.text: And Chanaan begot Sidon, his firstborn, the Hethite,

16.text: And the Jebusite, and the Amorrhite, and the Gergesite,

17.text: The Hevite and the Aracite: the Sinite,

18.text: And the Aradian, the Samarite, and the Hamathite: and afterwards the families of the Chanaanites were spread abroad.

19.text: And the limits of Chanaan were from Sidon as one comes to Gerara even to Gaza, until thou enter Sodom and Gomorrha, and Adama, and Seboim even to Lesa.

20.text: These are the children of Cham in their kindreds, and tongues, and generations, and lands, and nations.

21.text: Of Sem also, the father of all children of Heber, the elder brother of Japheth, sons were born.

22.text: The sons of Sem: Elam and Assur, and Arphaxad, and Lud, and Aram.

23.text: The sons of Aram: Us and Hull, and Gether: and Mess.

24.text: But Arphaxad begot Sale, of whom was born Heber.

25.text: And to Heber were born two sons: the name of the one was Phaleg, because in his days the earth was divided: and his brotherâ€™s name Jectan.

26.text: Which Jectan begot Elmodad, and Saleph, and Asarmoth, Jare,

27.text: And Anduram, and Uzal, and Decla,

29.text: And Ophir, and Hevila, and Jobab.

30.text: And their dwelling was from Messa as we go on as far as Sephar, a mountain in the east.

31.text: These are the children of Sem according to their kindreds and tongues, and countries in their nations.

32.text: These are the families of Noe, according to their peoples and nations. By these were the nations divided on the earth after the flood.
